data.title: Warren Beatty Reds Screenplay
data.meta_description: Jack Nicholson & Warren Beatty! by Harry Lime and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Taschenbuch. Condition: Neu. nach der Bestellung gedruckt Neuware - Printed after ordering - Henry Warren Beatty, born on March 30th, 1937, Richmond, Virginia, US, is an actor and filmmaker. He's been nominated for 14 Academy Awards, 4 for Best Actor, 4 for Best Picture, 2 for Best Director, 3 for Original Screenplay, and one for Adapted Screenplay, having won Best Director for Reds (1981). Beatty is one of only 2 people to have been nominated for acting in, directing, writing, and producing the same movie, along with Orson Welles for Citizen Kane, having done so twice: first for Heaven Can Wait, with Buck Henry as co-director then again with Reds.

Mass Market Paperback. Condition: Good. Please see any and all photos connected with this listing. A bit scuffed but all pages intact and legible. Good reading copy. Clean. No store stamps. --- --- (AUTOBIOGRAPHY) --- Adela Rogers St. Johns was an American journalist, novelist, and screenwriter. She wrote a number of screenplays for silent movies and, late in life, appeared with other early twentieth-century figures as one of the "witnesses" in Warren Beatty's Reds, but she is most remembered for her groundbreaking exploits as a "girl reporter" during the 1920s and 1930s. . .See photos for additional content. . .

Mass Market Paperback. Condition: Good. Please see any and all photos connected with this listing. A bit scuffed but all pages intact and legible. Good reading copy. Clean. Store Stamped. --- --- (AUTOBIOGRAPHY) --- Adela Rogers St. Johns was an American journalist, novelist, and screenwriter. She wrote a number of screenplays for silent movies and, late in life, appeared with other early twentieth-century figures as one of the "witnesses" in Warren Beatty's Reds, but she is most remembered for her groundbreaking exploits as a "girl reporter" during the 1920s and 1930s. . .See photos for additional content. . .

First Edition. Oversize format, 9 inches x 12 inches. Near fine condition with a hint of edge wear to the covers. The host for the event was Johnny Carson and it was held at the Dorothy Chandler Pavilion in Los Angeles on March 29, 1982. The top winners included Chariots of Fire for Best Picture, Warren Beatty for Best Director (Reds), Henry Fonda for Best Actor (On Golden Pond), Katharine Hepburn for Best Actress (On Golden Pond), John Gielgud for Best Supporting Actor (Arthur), Maureen Stapledon for Best Supporting Actress (Reds), Colin Welland for Best Original Screenplay (Chariots of Fire), Ernest Thompson for Best Adapted Screenplay (On Golden Pond, based on his play), and Mephisto for Best Foreign Film, directed by Istvan Szabo.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition First Printing. Contains the complete screenplay for the 1967 film starring Warren Beatty & Faye Dunaway, along with extensive interviews, essays, & commentaries that take you behind the scenes into the making of the movie. In 223 pages with black-and-white photo stills from the movie throughout. A FIRST EDITION, First Printing, this hardcover is in VG condition: very clean, binding straight & strong, pages modestly tanned, commensurate with age. Light foxing/soiling to external page edges, most notable some small red dots to outside top edges & a black remainder mark to bottom edges. Interior completely clean. The unclipped DJ is downgraded to only Good due to a large chip missing from head of spine & lighter edgewear all around. Nicely protected in new mylar cover Free Our photos depict the Exact book you will receive, never "stock" images of books we don't actually have! Same day shipping on all orders received Weekdays by 2 pm (Pacific time); later orders, weekends, & holidays ship very next business day.

Linen-backed. Condition: Near Fine. First Edition. This is an ORIGINAL one-sheet movie poster for "REDS", the 1981 Paramount film starring Warren Beatty, Diane Keaton, Jack Nicholson, Paul Sorvino, Maureen Stapleton, Edward Herrmann, Jerzy Kosinski and George Plimpton. Directed by Warren Beatty. Experly linen mounted. Image: 27" x 41" plus 2" border. Based on the life of journalist Jack Reed, who wrote "Ten Days That Shook The World". "REDS" won Academy Awards for Best Director (Beatty), Best Supporting Actress (Maureen Stapleton) and Best Cinematography (Vittorio Storaro). A stunning poster, beautifully linen mounted and certainly suitable for framing. FREE SHIPPING to any United States address.

Revised Production Draft script for the 2001 film. Copy belonging to New York production coordinator Shelley Houis, with her annotations in manuscript ink and pencil on the title page and the verso of the final leaf. Script laid into a production binder belonging to Houis, containing approximately 85 pages of production documents, primarily cast and crew contact lists. An unfaithfully married architect attempts to balance his prosperous career with the demands of his wife and his mistress. The first film to pair Warren Beatty and Diane Keaton since "Reds" (1981). An infamously troubled production, one of the biggest box office flops in American film history, enduring reshoots in 2000, two years after principal shooting and after an extensive rewrite by Buck Henry. In the end it grossed a little over $10 million worldwide on a $150 million budget. Set in New York, Mississippi, California, and Idaho, shot on location in New York, California, and Idaho. Title page integral with front wrapper, dated 1-26-98, noted as Revised Production Draft, with credit for screenwriter Michael Laughlin. 125 leaves, with last page of text numbered 124. Xerographic duplication, rectos only. Pages Very Good plus, bound with two gold brads.

First Edition. Signed by actor Warren Beatty on the half-title beneath his printed name. Oversize format, 8 3/4Ó x 11 1/4Ó, 222 pages, illustrated throughout. Near fine bright copy with a trace of handling in a near fine dust jacket with some very minor handling and edge wear. The last film profiled in this book is Heaven Can Wait, released in 1978, directed by Warren Beatty and Buck Henry, starring Warren Beatty, Julie Christie, Dyan Cannon, Jack Warden, and James Mason. The film won an Oscar for Best Art Direction-Set Direction, and was nominated for Best Picture, Best Actor (Beatty), Best Director, Best Supporting Actor (Warden), Best Supporting Actress (Cannon), Best Screenplay, Best Cinematography, and Best Music - Original Score. Some of BeattyÕs other films include Splendor in the Grass (1961), Bonnie and Clyde (1967) which was nominated for Best Picture and Best Actor (Beatty), The Parallax View (1974), Shampoo (1975), Reds (1981) for which he won a Best Director Oscar and was nominated for Oscars for Best Picture, Best Actor, and Best Screenplay (shared with Trevor Griffiths), Bugsy (1991) for which he was nominated for a Best Actor Oscar, and Rules DonÕt Apply (2016).
